metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7602 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibTIFF 4.0.7 has a signed integer overflow, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this will not be fixed in precise/esm

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8').
